title: Humza Yousaf: We’d work with Labour on gender reform before election
description: Humza Yousaf said the Scottish Government has been unsuccessful in working with the current Westminster Government, following the Section 35 order of the Scotland Act which prevented the Gender Recognition Reform (Scotland) Bill from gaining royal assent.

title: Reader’s letter: Fairer voting system needed
description: Both Rishi Sunak and Keir Starmer recognise that politics is failing to deliver, but have yet to propose serious solutions. They should bring us all some new year cheer and commit themselves to a better voting system: proportional representation. — S. DANDO, Maythorne, Southwell.

title: DAN HODGES: Rishi started 2023 by vowing to bring us hope. He ends the year on the brink of a calamitous defeat
description: Unless Sunak understands why the last year has been a struggle, the New Year's message he delivers in a few days' time could prove to be the last from a Tory Prime Minister for a generation.

title: Reforming the House of Lords is a fool’s game – and Starmer knows it
description: Does Keir Starmer really want to waste his time on reforming the House of Lords? It’s not just pundits – and of course many peers themselves – who are asking this question. It’s also his own Shadow Cabinet and back office team. The Labour leader made the commitment a while ago, but his enthusiasm seemed to wane as other priorities crowded in.

title: Christmas offers 'promise of a brighter future', Rishi Sunak says - as party leaders deliver messages
description: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer used his festive message to say the story of Jesus was a reminder that "in times of darkness and despair, hope, love and peace are always worth advocating for".

title: Tories must cut taxes and immigration to win next election, poll finds
description: Rishi Sunak has been told he needs to unite the warring Tories if they want to win the next general election. A new poll has suggested cutting taxes and reducing immigration could be hot topics when voters go to the polling booth next year. It comes just days after the Prime Minister quashed rumours the vote would be held in 2025.
